alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:59PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Tyler, central Newton and Jasper Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockland to 6 miles east of Woodville to near Jasper to near Newton. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Woodville, Newton, Kirbyville, Colmesneil, Chester, Rockland, Town Bluff, Call, Ebenezer, Fred, Bon Weir, Burkeville, Browndell, Trout Creek, Spurger, Harrisburg, Stringtown, Farrsville and Magnolia Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
